channel.title: Finance
channel.description: Latest investing news and finance headlines straight from Wall Street.

item.title: Morgan Stanley: The S&P 500 will fail to break out for a third time in 18 months
item.description: Despite the S&P 500 closing at an all-time high on Friday, the index's internals and fundamentals are too weak to maintain the rally, Morgan Stanley said Monday.

item.title: Three options strategies for the week: July 29, 2019
item.description: The "Options Action" traders share which stocks they're watching this week.

item.title: US-China trade talks resume in Shanghai with tempered expectations
item.description: U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators are not showing any urgency ahead of their first official in-person meeting since the G-20 truce.

item.title: Goldman names Chipotle its favorite restaurant stock
item.description: Goldman Sachs initiates coverage of Chipotle with a buy rating and a $1,000 price target.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Pfizer, Mylan, BlackRock, Domino's & more
item.description: Names on the move ahead of the open.

item.title: UPS downgraded by Stifel: Investments could limit earnings growth next year
item.description: Stifel downgrades UPS to hold from buy and maintains its $118 per share price target

item.title: US companies are increasingly interested in China's big import event despite trade war
item.description: American companies remain keen on tapping business opportunities in China, despite trade tensions between the two countries.

item.title: Hong Kong protests not yet causing 'big movement of money' to Singapore, says bank CEO
item.description: Singapore — a tiny Southeast Asian country — and Hong Kong are often seen as competitors for the role of Asia's premier financial center.

item.title: Grab says it will invest $2 billion from Softbank into Indonesia
item.description: SoftBank Group CEO Masayoshi Son said Monday the Japanese conglomerate will invest $2 billion into Indonesia through ride-hailing giant Grab.

item.title: Wall Street bull expects the record rally to temporarily get tripped up
item.description: Oppenheimer Asset Management's John Stoltzfus expects wave of volatility to pressure stocks due to uncertainty.

item.title: Passive investing boom could cause a market bubble, but not in the stocks you would expect
item.description: Real estate and utilities are the two sectors that have benefited the most from the rise of passive investing vehicles.

item.title: Trump's Bronx golf course lost $122,000 last year and blamed New York City
item.description: The company's explanation for the loss, despite the sweetheart deal: A faulty gas pipe installed by the city that delayed a construction project.

item.title: Chewy founder: We're no Pets.com
item.description: Chewy founder defends his company against criticism from money manager.

item.title: The Fed is about to cut rates for the first time since 2008 as trade war weighs on economic growth
item.description: The Fed is expected to cut rates by a quarter point, in a preventative move aimed at limiting the impact of trade wars on the U.S. economy.

item.title: The IRS is warning thousands of cryptocurrency holders to pay their taxes
item.description: The IRS is in the process of sending letters to U.S. citizens who own virtual currency and potentially failed to pay the necessary taxes.

item.title: Dish Network and its billionaire co-founder Charlie Ergen finally have a plan
item.description: For about a decade, Dish co-founder and Chairman Charlie Ergen has wanted to get into the wireless business. With the DOJ's approval of T-Mobile's merger with Sprint, he's finally found a real way in.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Twitter, Starbucks, Alphabet, Goodyear Tire & more
item.description: Names on the move ahead of the open.

item.title: Strong consumer spending vs. weak business investment: What really matters for the US economy
item.description: U.S. consumer spending, the biggest part of the economy, saved the day for the record-long expansion, but a big decline in business investments raised concerns about how much longer it can last.

item.title: Fed expected to cut rates as economy feels trade war impact, despite strengthening consumer
item.description: The Fed is expected to cut interest rates Wednesday, after second quarter GDP shows inflation is still sluggish and trade wars are impacting business.

item.title: Kudlow: 'I wouldn't expect any grand deal' on China
item.description: National Economic Council's Larry Kudlow dampened expectations about major breakthroughs coming from U.S.-China trade talks next week.

item.title: These are the 5 best cities in the US for retirement
item.description: The 5 best cities in the U.S. to spend your retirement in.

item.title: Your first trade for Friday, July 26
item.description: The "Fast Money" traders share their first moves for the market open.

item.title: Meet your future self. It might just give you a bigger retirement nest egg
item.description: Retirement savings gets an assist from an app that shows you your future self.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Twitter, Amazon, Alphabet, Apple, Intel & more
item.description: Names on the move ahead of the open.

item.title: Charles Schwab to buy USAA assets in $1.8 billion deal
item.description: Charles Schwab plans to buy assets of USAA, including brokerage and managed portfolio accounts, for $1.8 billion in cash.

item.title: China wants to track and grade each citizen's actions — it's in the testing phase
item.description: China is forging ahead with efforts to create a national social credit system. Some analysts doubt authorities can reach their goal.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Alphabet, Amazon, Starbucks and more
item.description: See which stocks are posting big moves after the bell.

item.title: US growth could be weakest in more than two years but latest data might not affect Fed's next move
item.description: The GDP report will likely have little bearing on the Fed when it holds its rates meeting next week.

item.title: Hedge fund manager Kyle Bass says a US-China trade deal can't be reached
item.description: Hedge fund manager Kyle Bass is doubtful a trade deal between the U.S. and China can be reached and believes rate cuts are less effective these days.

item.title: Companies weigh impact of China and trade, and it's not all bad
item.description: Companies report varying impacts from China amid trade squabbles.
